授業の概要・背景: The course will focus on how the UN and other international bodies contribute to consensus building and formulate their own strategies, medium term plans and programmes, and work with national partners in developing policies and programmes in implementing urgent and longer term climate action.
授業方法: This class will be held in both face to face on campus and online face to face style. Seminar discussions on research results and case reviews.

第1回:
9/20 Introduction and overview of the class, objectives, expectations by students, preparation for final presentation
SDGs and global environmental issues:
Sustainable development Goal #13 and relevant goals
The Paris agreement
Assignment: Students prepare one-page summary of the Paris Agreement and identify key issues, including cause, situation, threats, strategies and actions.
第2回:
9/27 Global warming and climate change:
Current global environmental issues. Science of climate change and climate change denial
Global warming, the causes:
Analysing multiple causes
Identifying key factors and players
Assignment: Students prepare a one page strategy to convince and convert climate change deniers to take climate action
第3回: 10/4 Global warming and vulnerability: Assessing climate vulnerability and identifying vulnerable groups, Climate refugees?
Assignment: Students prepare 3-slide presentation on how to identify vulnerable groups in developing countries.
第4回:
10/11 Climate action:
Policy advocacy, Communication for action, developing communication strategies on climate change
Assignment: Students prepare a one-page advocacy and communication strategy to promote climate action in a developing country of their choice
第5回:
10/18 Climate change mitigation actions:
Reducing anthropogenic emission of greenhouse gas
Reforestation and new technologies
Assignment: Students prepare a 3-slide presentation on available technology options to mitigate greenhouse gases.
第6回:
10/25 Climate change mitigation actions: Carbon footprint
What can we do to reduce carbon emission?
Assignment: Each student analyses the “101 ways to fight climate change” and create one mind map, so that she/he can explain what we can do to fight climate change, in 3 minutes.
第7回:
11/1 Global consensus building processes: Preparing for Egypt COP27 and key issues
UNFCCC and COP process, IPCC's contribution, actors, moving the Paris agreementforward,
Depending on the availability, invite a staff of UNFCCC and discuss on the issue of global consensus building for sustainable environment and climate action.
Assignment: Students summarise key steps and approaches in building global consensus on climate change and climate action
第8回:
11/8 COP27 Issues and policy formulation
Implementation of Paris agreement:
Working with partners and governments
Differentiation (CBDR-RC)
Assignment: Students prepare presentations on the assessment of the current implementation status of the Paris Agreement and key challenges for full implementation.
第9回:
11/15 Prof. Akiko Fujii
SDGs and Climate Change: How Climate-integrated approach can accelerate achieving SDGs. How ‘Leave No One Behind’ and Climate actions are inter-linked and mutually supportive.
Assignment: Students prepare a one-page mind-map of inter-linkages between key climate process and SDGs
第10回:
11/22 Prof. Akiko Fujii
UNDP's Work on Climate Change: How UNDP addresses climate change in achieving SDGs. How ‘human development’ approach is applied in UNDP’s climate programmes.
Assignment: Students prepare a one-page summary of UNDP's approach to climate change.
第11回:
11/29 Prof. Akiko Fujii
Climate Finance: What are challenges and opportunities of climate finance in achieving SDGs. How UNDP works with climate finance mechanism and relevant partners, including case studies from Vietnam etc.
Assignment: Students prepare a presentation on one UN agency's work on Climate change.
第12回:
12/6 Prof. Akiko Fujii
Climate Change and Small Island Developing States (SIDS): What ‘Climate Change’ means in SIDS context. What are challenges and opportunities of planning and implementing Climate Actions in SIDS, including case studies from Maldives etc.
Assignment: Students prepare a one-page note on their final presentation with title, brief background, research question and main references.
第13回: 12/13 Roles of private sector and civil society in climate mitigation and adaptation, and linking lifestyle with climate action: Students make short presentations on cases of corporates or civil society organizations addressing climate issues through their activities.
第14回: 12/20 Final presentation and critique: Students presentation on how to address climate issues through their life, including change of their lifestyle, career choices and policy advocacy. End of class evaluation
